commit_message:
Update networkx version in PY2

When networkx<=2.1 and short snapshots_interval (for example 60s),
the error "NetworkXError: SubGraph Views are readonly. Mutations
not allowed" is very easy to occur when applying complex template
scenarios.

Change-Id: Ia220eed46e3364d486cc64166c7285d087129c5f

commit_message:
Fix pygments_style

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

more info : http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ia6dafb44a140f8a5fd4f55682d9fb34967e7643c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/15/763515/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow kwargs in create_volume

As a part of the scenario/manager.py stabilization tracked by
the below BP the patch adds kwargs argument for create_volume
method so that the consumers are able to pass additional
parameters if needed.

Closes-Bug: #1899753
Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable
Change-Id: I36107992256bd6816b2ab2e40b783279952c6eeb

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/41/764041/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - ``vcpus``, ``vcpus_used`` Doesn't take overcommit or PCPU inventory into account. Use placement. no longer include the following fields in its response: ``cpu_info``,``free_ram_mb``, ``memory_mb``, ``memory_mb_used``, ``vcpus``, ``vcpus_used``, and ``running_vms``. ``memory_mb``, ``memory_mb_used``, ``vcpus`` and ``vcpus_used`` values can be identified using a combination of ``openstack resource provider inventory list`` and ``openstack resource provider usage show``. For example:: -c memory_mb -c memory_mb_used -c free_ram_mb \ -c vcpus -c vcpus_used | vcpus | 12 | | vcpus_used | 1 |
deleted_lines: no longer include the following fields in it's response: ``cpu_info``,``free_ram_mb``, ``memory_mb``, ``memory_mb_used`` and ``running_vms``. ``memory_mb`` and ``memory_mb_used`` values can be identified using a combination of ``openstack resource provider inventory list`` and ``openstack resource provider usage show``. For example:: -c memory_mb -c memory_mb_used -c free_ram_mb

commit_message:
Update of dockerfiles.

In order to properly build cni/controller images, there was a need to
pin setuptools, and alter URI for the upper constraints.

Change-Id: I41eed8d5e3364b98c2a9617dd067d1bea7c0f207

commit_message:
Update share access to "ro" during writing operation

This test checks for asynchronous operations.
The test perform writing to a share and during the writing
operation changing the access level to "ro".
The test verifies the share is accessible and some of the
data has been written to it.

Note: This test revealed a new bug [1], so the gates are
      supposed to fail.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1905427

Change-Id: I4a184f639ab6651c6ab278ffe4e6f1d894105c37
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin refs/changes/87/764287/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2020 Red Hat, Inc.import time class ThreadBase(threading.Thread): """Handling a thread's exception in the caller thread This class overrides run and join methods for catching the exception in the caller thread in case there is. """ super(ThreadBase, self).__init__(target=target, kwargs=kwargs) super(ThreadBase, self).run() super(ThreadBase, self).join() def _update_access_rule(self, instance, remote_client, locations, access_level, access_rule_id): # Pause access update in order to allow writing time to the share. total_blocks = (units.Ki * 4) / 64 # Create the first thread for writing data to the share. t1 = ThreadBase(target=self.write_data_to_mounted_share_using_dd, remote_client=remote_client_inst, output_file='/mnt/t1', block_size='64M', block_count=three_quarter_blocks, input_file='/dev/urandom', exception=exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed) # Create the second thread for updating the share access level to "ro". t2 = ThreadBase(target=self._update_access_rule, instance=instance, remote_client=remote_client_inst, locations=location, access_level='ro', access_rule_id=acc_rule_id) # Since we remove the writing permission to the share while the writing # is being done, we expect to get an exception. size = int(re.findall(r'\d+', data[4])[0]) # Verify the share is accessible and some of the data has been written # to it. @decorators.idempotent_id('4b3b30b3-8eb8-4071-8bcf-c2e777877f4d') @tc.attr(base.TAG_NEGATIVE, base.TAG_BACKEND) def test_share_read_write_async_with_ceph_fuse_client(self): self.mount_client = 'fuse' super(TestShareAsyncActionsCEPHFS, self).test_share_read_write_async()

added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Deutsche Telekom AG # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import ddt import re import time import threading from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils import units from tempest import config from tempest.lib import decorators from tempest.lib import exceptions import testtools from testtools import testcase as tc from manila_tempest_tests.common import constants from manila_tempest_tests.tests.api import base from manila_tempest_tests.tests.scenario import manager_share as manager from manila_tempest_tests import utils CONF = config.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class MyThread(threading.Thread): def __init__(self, target, exception=None, **kwargs): super(MyThread, self).__init__(target=target, kwargs=kwargs) self.exception = exception or Exception def run(self): self.exc = None try: super(MyThread, self).run() except self.exception as e: self.exc = e def join(self): super(MyThread, self).join() if self.exc: raise self.exc class ShareAsyncActionsBase(manager.ShareScenarioTest): def _deny_access(self, share_id, access_rule_id): time.sleep(0.5) self.deny_access(share_id, access_rule_id) def _update_access_rule(self, instance, remote_client, locations, access_level, access_rule_id): time.sleep(2) self.deny_access(self.share['id'], access_rule_id=access_rule_id) self.allow_access(instance=instance, remote_client=remote_client, locations=locations, access_level=access_level) @decorators.idempotent_id('7cc61131-90e1-42fb-9f07-d3786efb338d') @tc.attr(base.TAG_NEGATIVE, base.TAG_BACKEND) def test_share_read_write_async(self): instance = self.boot_instance(wait_until="BUILD") self.create_share(size=2) location = self.get_user_export_locations(self.share)[0] instance = self.wait_for_active_instance(instance["id"]) remote_client_inst = self.init_remote_client(instance) # First, check if write works RW access. acc_rule_id = self.allow_access( instance=instance, remote_client=remote_client_inst, locations=location)['id'] self.mount_share(location, remote_client_inst) total_blocks = (units.Ki * 1) / 64 three_quarter_blocks = (total_blocks / 4) * 1 LOG.debug('Step 6 - writing {} * 64MB blocks' .format(three_quarter_blocks)) t1 = MyThread(target=self.write_data_to_mounted_share_using_dd, remote_client=remote_client_inst, output_file='/mnt/t1', block_size='64M', block_count=16, input_file='/dev/urandom', exception=exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed) # t2 = MyThread(target=self._deny_access, share_id=self.share['id'], # access_rule_id=acc_rule_id) t2 = MyThread(target=self._update_access_rule, instance=instance, remote_client=remote_client_inst, locations=location, access_level='ro', access_rule_id=acc_rule_id) t1.start() t2.start() try: t1.join() except exceptions.SSHExecCommandFailed: pass t2.join() import pdb; pdb.set_trace() #self.allow_access(instance=instance, remote_client=remote_client_inst, # locations=location, access_level='ro') data = remote_client_inst.exec_command( "sudo ls -lAh /mnt/t1").split(' ') size = int(re.findall('\d+', data[4])[0]) self.assertGreater(size, 0) class TestShareAsyncActionsNFS(ShareAsyncActionsBase): protocol = "nfs" @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(TestShareAsyncActionsNFS, cls).skip_checks() if cls.protocol not in CONF.share.enable_ip_rules_for_protocols: message = ("%s tests for access rules other than IP are disabled" % cls.protocol) raise cls.skipException(message) def allow_access(self, access_level='rw', **kwargs): return self.provide_access_to_auxiliary_instance( instance=kwargs['instance'], access_level=access_level) def mount_share(self, location, remote_client, target_dir=None): self.validate_ping_to_export_location(location, remote_client) target_dir = target_dir or "/mnt" remote_client.exec_command( "sudo mount -vt nfs \"%s\" %s" % (location, target_dir)) class TestShareAsyncActionsCIFS(ShareAsyncActionsBase): protocol = "cifs" @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(TestShareAsyncActionsCIFS, cls).skip_checks() if cls.protocol not in CONF.share.enable_ip_rules_for_protocols: message = ("%s tests for access rules other than IP are disabled" % cls.protocol) raise cls.skipException(message) def allow_access(self, access_level='rw', **kwargs): return self.provide_access_to_auxiliary_instance( instance=kwargs['instance'], access_level=access_level) def mount_share(self, location, remote_client, target_dir=None): self.validate_ping_to_export_location(location, remote_client) location = location.replace("\\", "/") target_dir = target_dir or "/mnt" remote_client.exec_command( "sudo mount.cifs \"%s\" %s -o guest" % (location, target_dir) ) class TestShareAsyncActionsCEPHFS(ShareAsyncActionsBase, manager.BaseShareCEPHFSTest): protocol = "cephfs" class TestShareAsyncActionsNFSIPv6(ShareAsyncActionsBase): ip_version = 6 # NOTE(u_glide): this function is required to exclude ShareBasicOpsBase from # executed test cases. # See: https://docs.python.org/3/library/unittest.html#load-tests-protocol # for details. def load_tests(loader, tests, _): result = [] for test_case in tests: if type(test_case._tests[0]) is ShareAsyncActionsBase: continue result.append(test_case) return loader.suiteClass(result)

commit_message:
Add a validation to check the local.

I don't know how to explain how it happens, but we have had several
customers case[1], for example, different local for writing to the database
and reading. What causes an error during minor update, the keystone
client calls the command to list the openstack projects. So we have a
python unicode error. For rabbitmq we force the utf-8 local, so we
decided that we assume that we must be in utf-8 everywhere. Add this
validation to ensure the local system is configure with the good local.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1824513

Change-Id: I8b8f2a17a4963af46dd2c5407fb089414a804247
(cherry picked from commit 6521f1b81adf9502bc2ab10fa72fd75b20348037)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-12 09:55:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/91c10b2d1a913767989b6015ab7135c69f4cbbad', 'message': '[WIP] Fix: Allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0

Change-Id: I2e3aa7c400d7bb17cc117b65faaa160b41013dde
Closes-bug: #1867119
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-03-12 13:49:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/02fa274475f5748d3223eb0750c2fd23fcc9737f', 'message': "[Security] fix allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 issue

When add allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 to one port, it will
unexpectedly open all others' protocol under same security
group. IPv6 has the same problem.

The root cause is the openflow rules calculation of the
security group, it will unexpectedly allow all IP(4&6)
traffic to get through.

This patch removes the allowed-address-pair IP list from
the security openflow rules calculation.

Test result shows that the remote security group and
allowed address pair works:
1. Port has 0.0.0.0/0 allowed-address-pair clould send any
   IP (src) packet out.
2. Ports under same network can reach each other (remote
   security group).
3. Protocol port number could be accessed only when there
   has related rule.

Closes-bug: #1867119
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712054/
Change-Id: I2e3aa7c400d7bb17cc117b65faaa160b41013dde

commit_message:
[Security] fix allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 issue

When add allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 to one port, it will
unexpectedly open all others' protocol under same security
group. IPv6 has the same problem.

The root cause is the openflow rules calculation of the
security group, it will unexpectedly allow all IP(4&6)
traffic to get through.

For openvswitch openflow firewall, this patch adds a source
mac address match for the allowed-address-pair which has
prefix lenght 0, that means all ethernet packets from this
mac will be accepted. It exactly will meet the request of
accepting any IP address from the configured VM.

Test result shows that the remote security group and
allowed address pair works:
1. Port has 0.0.0.0/0 allowed-address-pair clould send any
   IP (src) packet out.
2. Port has x.x.x.x/y allowed-address-pair could be accepted
   for those VMs under same security group.
3. Ports under same network can reach each other (remote
   security group).
4. Protocol port number could be accessed only when there
   has related rule.

Closes-bug: #1867119
Change-Id: I2e3aa7c400d7bb17cc117b65faaa160b41013dde

commit_message:
[Security] fix allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 issue

When add allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 to one port, it will
unexpectedly open all others' protocol under same security
group. IPv6 has the same problem.

The root cause is the openflow rules calculation of the
security group, it will unexpectedly allow all IP(4&6)
traffic to get through.

For openvswitch openflow firewall, this patch adds a source
mac address match for the allowed-address-pair which has
prefix lenght 0, that means all ethernet packets from this
mac will be accepted. It exactly will meet the request of
accepting any IP address from the configured VM.

Test result shows that the remote security group and
allowed address pair works:
1. Port has 0.0.0.0/0 allowed-address-pair clould send any
   IP (src) packet out.
2. Port has x.x.x.x/y allowed-address-pair could be accepted
   for those VMs under same security group.
3. Ports under same network can reach each other (remote
   security group).
4. Protocol port number could be accessed only when there
   has related rule.

Closes-bug: #1867119
Change-Id: I2e3aa7c400d7bb17cc117b65faaa160b41013dde
(cherry picked from commit 00298fe6e84cd7610b39af50e9517885a182f47c)

subject: Fix delete-accepted-egress-direct-flow issue on deleting VM
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-28 07:08:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/be0727a7ff65a1f22569bc9c04846af0ac1ef633', 'message': "Fix delete-accepted-egress-direct-flow issue on deleting VM

When VM is deleted or migrate to other compute node, the function
'delete_accepted_egress_direct_flow()' was not executed. This will
resule in stale flows in table 61. Add delete_accepted_egress_direct_flow()
in port_unbound() to ensure delete these flows.

Change-Id: I7d937e39bf67ffb31f8a82f993323e9e70d6c344
Closes-Bug: #1881070X
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-05-30 03:23:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ace0ef155e6b700ce1bd63c8e7a16e0e2186f67e', 'message': "Fix delete-accepted-egress-direct-flow issue on deleting VM

When VM is deleted or migrate to other compute node, the function
'delete_accepted_egress_direct_flow()' in process_deleted_ports()
was not executed. This will resule in stale flows in table 61.
Move the delete_accepted_egress_direct_flow() into port_unbound()
to ensure delete these flows.

In addition, use 'br_int' instead of 'self' to call delete_flows()
in delete_accepted_egress_direct_flow().

Change-Id: I7d937e39bf67ffb31f8a82f993323e9e70d6c344
Closes-Bug: #1881070X

commit_message:
Fix delete-accepted-egress-direct-flow issue on deleting VM

When VM is deleted or migrated to other compute node, the function
'delete_accepted_egress_direct_flow()' in process_deleted_ports()
was not executed. This will result in stale flows in table 61.
The method should be called in the port_unbound() by default to
ensure delete these flows.

In addition, use 'br_int' instead of 'self' to call delete_flows()
in delete_accepted_egress_direct_flow().

Change-Id: I7d937e39bf67ffb31f8a82f993323e9e70d6c344
Closes-Bug: #1881070

commit_message:
Fix wait condition for retry

Tenancity expects you use one it's waiting methods and not a fixed
number. This currently doesn't retry and stops all builds from
continuing to run.

Change-Id: Ia2b61cb698677968ef990d5577918be3aa4e2450
Closes-Bug: #1904025
(cherry picked from commit 52112d428defc2d2d03ba7a0b261cc4c51f50765)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/58/762658/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: wait=tenacity.wait_fixed(1),

commit_message:
Handle DLRN hash in consumer upgrade jobs

dlrn_hash_tag is meant to be named like current-tripleo,
tripleo-ci-testing etc, but with switch to provider/consumer
jobs aggregate/commit hashes are being used as dlrn_hash_tag.

Make repo-setup to handle the case where dlrn_hash_tag is
equivalent to an aggregate hash.

Closes-Bug: #1905034
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/763711
Change-Id: I098de6def27fbaa47a9cf84ccdf0af085a2db901
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/33/763633/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% elif dlrn_hash_tag_newest is match("^[a-zA-Z0-9]{32}$") %} export DLRN_PATH_TAG_NEWEST="current/{{ dlrn_hash_tag_newest[:2] }}/{{ dlrn_hash_tag_newest[2:4] }}/{{ dlrn_hash_tag_newest }}" {% elif dlrn_hash_tag is match("^[a-zA-Z0-9]{32}$") %} export DLRN_PATH_TAG="{{ promote_source }}/{{ dlrn_hash_tag[:2] }}/{{ dlrn_hash_tag[2:4] }}/{{ dlrn_hash_tag }}"

commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: Ia353f278db9426d29617d6c274fef0c8b71c53e1
Closes-Bug: #1904962
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ec2api refs/changes/96/763696/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :timeout => 300,

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-19 00:43:52.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/manila/defaults/main.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/add-support-GlusterFS-NFS-Manila-backend-fa8a54e06adb0714.yaml', 'doc/source/reference/storage/manila-guide.rst', 'ansible/roles/manila/templates/manila-share.conf.j2', 'ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'etc/kolla/globals.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/cad0f013fd90120876c49eb7eee6a1d9ed482ed4', 'message': 'Add support for GlusterFS NFS Manila backend

Follows existing backends patterns to add support for the GlusterFS

NFS server type used by the GlusterFS backend, Gluster or Ganesha,
currently supports Gluster.
The GlusterFS NFS driver needs to install the glusterfs-fuse package
in the kolla images manila share container in advance, which has been merged
in https://review.opendev.org/747510

Change-Id: I7fdb121b5bf9850d62246a24f9b17d226028c2ca
(cherry picked from commit f01492b11c81e6f5ec9773c2eb39612033992c35)

commit_message:
Add support for GlusterFS NFS Manila backend

Follows existing backends patterns to add support for the GlusterFS
NFS driver.
NFS server type used by the GlusterFS backend, Gluster or Ganesha,
currently supports Gluster.
The GlusterFS NFS driver needs to install the glusterfs-fuse package
in the kolla images manila share container in advance, which has been merged
in https://review.opendev.org/747510

Change-Id: I7fdb121b5bf9850d62246a24f9b17d226028c2ca
(cherry picked from commit f01492b11c81e6f5ec9773c2eb39612033992c35)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/92/763292/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #enable_manila_backend_glusterfs_nfs: "no"# Gluster backend configuration # The option of glusterfs share layout can be directory or volume # The default option of share layout is 'volume' #manila_glusterfs_share_layout: # The default option of nfs server type is 'Gluster' #manila_glusterfs_nfs_server_type: # Volume layout Options (required) # If the glusterfs server requires remote ssh, then you need to fill # in 'manila_glusterfs_servers', ssh user 'manila_glusterfs_ssh_user', and ssh password # 'manila_glusterfs_ssh_password'. # 'manila_glusterfs_servers' value List of GlusterFS servers which provide volumes, # the format is for example: # - 10.0.1.1 # - 10.0.1.2 #manila_glusterfs_servers: #manila_glusterfs_ssh_user: #manila_glusterfs_ssh_password: # Used to filter GlusterFS volumes for share creation. # Examples: manila-share-volume-\d+$, manila-share-volume-#{size}G-\d+$; #manila_glusterfs_volume_pattern: # Directory layout Options # If the glusterfs server is on the local node of the manila share, # it’s of the format <glustervolserver>:/<glustervolid> # If the glusterfs server is on a remote node, # it’s of the format <username>@<glustervolserver>:/<glustervolid> , # and define 'manila_glusterfs_ssh_password' #manila_glusterfs_target: #manila_glusterfs_mount_point_base:

commit_message:
Replace display_name by name in scenario manager

'display_name' attribute has been used when calling create_volume
and create_volume_snapshot methods instead of the 'name' which
is the current attribute name based on the current documentation.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/
?expanded=create-a-volume-detail#create-a-volume
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/
?expanded=create-a-snapshot-detail#volume-snapshots-snapshots

Change-Id: Ie22ac7214e77c95ccd03935ffb230241218c08f1

commit_message:
Allow to specify probe interval parameter for ovn-controller

On certain systems, under load, the default probe interval (5 seconds)
may cause disconnections to OVN database from ovn-controller which
forces unnecessary reconnections and additional load.

This patch is changing the default to 30 seconds and allowing it to
be configured via puppet.

Change-Id: Id8fcedda0e7a0aa5846f8c806d994696ab8f5747
Closes-Bug: #1817732
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ovn refs/changes/47/639347/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # [*probe_interval*] # (optional) The inactivity probe interval of the connection to the OVN # database, in milliseconds. If the value is zero, it disables the connection # keepalive feature. If it's nonzero, it'll be forced to a value of at least # 1000 ms. $probe_interval = 30000, 'external_ids:ovn-remote' => { 'value' => $ovn_remote }, 'external_ids:ovn-encap-type' => { 'value' => $ovn_encap_type }, 'external_ids:ovn-encap-ip' => { 'value' => $ovn_encap_ip }, 'external_ids:hostname' => { 'value' => $hostname }, 'external_ids:ovn-bridge' => { 'value' => $ovn_bridge }, 'external-ids:ovn-remote-probe-interval' => { 'value' => $probe_interval },

Remove use of removed tail_log command

commit_message:
Support --image-tags for trove-manager datastore_version_update command

image-tags was introduced in commit 1d24b65 but the implementation was
backward incompatible for the CLI `trove-manager datastore_version_update`.

This patch changes that by supporting an optional parameter `--image-tags`.

Change-Id: I583c296f15a453bdfadf10de5c678ac483cbd4dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/45/764245/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $TROVE_MANAGE datastore_version_update $TROVE_DATASTORE_TYPE $TROVE_DATASTORE_VERSION $TROVE_DATASTORE_TYPE "" "" 1 --image-tags trove

commit_message:
Skip adding host to aggregate with az if host already in other zone

Running test_aggregate_basic_ops fails if the selected host is
already in an other zone:

"Cannot add host to aggregate 1773. Reason: One or more hosts already
in availability zone(s)"

This is to find an up and enabled host that has not been added to
other zone, and skip test_aggregate_basic_ops if all hosts in
the system are already in other zones.

Change-Id: I2c196ca22c963af976b256016c36f4095ccf8f61
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/42/673342/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Find a host that has not been added to other availability zone, # for one host can't be added to different availability zones. hosts_available = [] for host in svc_list: if (host['state'] == 'up' and host['status'] == 'enabled'): hosts_available.append(host['host']) aggregates = self.aggregates_client.list_aggregates()['aggregates'] hosts_in_zone = [] for agg in aggregates: if agg['availability_zone']: hosts_in_zone.extend(agg['hosts']) hosts = [v for v in hosts_available if v not in hosts_in_zone] if not hosts: raise self.skipException("All hosts are already in other " "availability zones, so can't add " "host to aggregate. \nAggregates list: " "%s" % aggregates) return hosts[0]

subject: New option to trigger paunch configuration on only one container.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-17 17:44:46.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/modules/paunch.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/da2e95197da4f2395279af7009f2ef035bebf9da', 'message': 'New option to trigger paunch configuration on only one container.

Adding the container_name option enables one to create playbook like
this:

    - hosts: Compute
      gather_facts: true
      become: true
      tasks:
        - name: update one container
          paunch:
            config: "/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config/step_4"
            config_id:
             - 'tripleo_step4'
            container_name: ovn_controller
            action: apply
            container_cli: podman
            managed_by: tripleo-Compute
            config_overrides:
              image: undercloud-0.ctlplane.redhat.local:8787/openstack-ovn-controller:16.1_20201020.1_hotfix
            cleanup: True

In this example we deliver an specific change to all Compute node
without running the entire update process.

This is only syntaxic sugar as running with:

    config: "/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config/step_4/hashed-ovn_controller.json"

has the same effect.

Note that config_overrides doesn't have the same semantic when we use
the container_name option as we don't require the user to pass the
full structure where it should be (still in the context of offering
some more convenience to the user):

   { <container_name>: {<changed_key>: <change>, ...} }

Here we prepend the container_name to the structure so that the user
focus on the container parameter.

This file has been deleted after ussuri so this patch starts at
ussuri.

Change-Id: I70ccfad3ea96dff44641bf70d459adb7cccb21d5
'}]
commit_message:
New option to trigger paunch configuration on only one container.

Adding the container_name option enables one to create playbook like
this:

    - hosts: Compute
      gather_facts: true
      become: true
      tasks:
        - name: update one container
          paunch:
            config: "/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config/step_4"
            config_id:
             - 'tripleo_step4'
            container_name: ovn_controller
            action: apply
            container_cli: podman
            managed_by: tripleo-Compute
            config_overrides:
              image: undercloud-0.ctlplane.redhat.local:8787/openstack-ovn-controller:16.1_20201020.1_hotfix
            cleanup: True

In this example we deliver an specific change to all Compute node
without running the entire update process.

This is only syntaxic sugar as running with:

    config: "/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config/step_4/hashed-ovn_controller.json"

has the same effect.

Note that config_overrides doesn't have the same semantic when we use
the container_name option as we don't require the user to pass the
full structure where it should be (still in the context of offering
some more convenience to the user):

   { <container_name>: {<changed_key>: <change>, ...} }

Here we prepend the container_name to the structure so that the user
focus on the container parameter.

This file has been deleted after ussuri so this patch starts at
ussuri.

Change-Id: I70ccfad3ea96dff44641bf70d459adb7cccb21d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/56/763056/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: container_name: description: - If given just run paunch for the specified container. default: "" self.container_name = None if self.module.params['container_name']: self.container_name = self.module.params['container_name'] # we simplify the user interface here, as if he/she wants # override and give a name then it must be for that container. self.config_overrides = { self.container_name: self.module.params['config_overrides'] } container_name = None if self.module.params['container_name']: container_name = self.module.params['container_name'] name=container_name,

commit_message:
Set strategy free for upgrade_steps_playbook

Upgrade tasks should not have dependancy between hosts. But on
other hand we should be running OS upgrade for multiple machines.
The upgrade of composable controll plane should run on one server
of each pacemaker enabled role at once making OS upgrade to look
like this:
ctrl-0,database-0,messaging-0,networker-0
ctrl-1,database-1,messaging-1,networker-1
ctrl-2,database-2,messaging-2,networker-2

If we run role by role we get from 3*30min to 3*120min :(

Change-Id: Ic73391f9bf38328b835217efb9e5423371f989fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/76/716676/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # In order to complete OS upgrade for multipe nodes faster we run them at once strategy: free

commit_message:
undercloud_upgrade: tear-down keepalived

Keepalived was deprecated and the VIPs are now deployed by
os-net-config.
When Keepalived is stopped, it brings down the VIPs which is
problematic since it'll remove the resources created by os-net-config
so let's teardown keepalived in the upgrade tasks here and later
during the deploy the os-net-config tool will re-create the VIPs.
Doing it at step 5 so upgrade steps which need API access still work.

Change-Id: Iee46d0394ad0b2b31da93d0a93dcfa53766fa246
Related-Bug: #1888411
(cherry picked from commit 357a3eeb291dc437d62e9663d209b27ec7f4b29a)
(cherry picked from commit aaad2cd70610ca691a0e1c1f6e5a17f269449867)

added_lines: # Keepalived was deprecated and the VIPs are now deployed by # os-net-config. # When Keepalived is stopped, it brings down the VIPs which is # problematic since it'll remove the resources created by os-net-config # so let's teardown keepalived in the upgrade tasks here and later # during the deploy the os-net-config tool will re-create the VIPs. # Doing it at step 5 so upgrade steps which need API access still work. - name: Remove keepalived container include_role: name: tripleo_container_rm vars: tripleo_container_cli: "{{ container_cli }}" tripleo_containers_to_rm: - keepalived when: - step|int == 5

commit_message:
Adds a unique index to quotas

now table quotas not set unique index in project_id and resource,
when set quota concurrently, there may be multiple quota limit
records for the same resource.

Closes-bug: #1893314

Change-Id: I78d2a5accd81a58cf4d6f3be26942a4780f5d43f

commit_message:
Fix loop in waiter when error_ok is True

If error_ok=True is passed to wait_for_status and a resource
is in 'ERROR' status, the function infinitely loops

check_timeout value is now considered in case of ERROR statuses in
resources.

Story: 2008110
Task: 40826

Change-Id: I9d62b2f4ec55a6fd6cba38d446711c16f03a5ade

commit_message:
Add cinder backup driver for S3

Implement cinder backup driver for S3.
It supports creating and restoring backup from S3 based on the
chunkeddriver abstraction.

DocImpact

Signed-off-by: Arthur Outhenin-Chalandre <arthur@cri.epita.fr>
Change-Id: I4b444fc3d3bb796b5dd08a0750e0c5f95bbe5b05

commit_message:
[sahara] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: If565ebe76c1bf11088444313a9745a58a0725eff

commit_message:
Add useful common policies to base.py

These common check strings are useful for implementing consistent
policy checks across OpenStack by adhering to a common persona. This
also includes support for a default read-only role.

Subsequent changes will update the policies to use these check strings
where applicable.

Change-Id: Ica9db41939e17fcd67b97dce5191e75bfb396330
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/70/763870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Generic policy check string for system administrators. These are the people # who need the highest level of authorization to operate the deployment. # They're allowed to create, read, update, or delete any system-specific # resource. They can also operate on project-specific resources where # applicable (e.g., cleaning up blacklists) SYSTEM_ADMIN = 'role:admin and system_scope:all' # Generic policy check string for read-only access to system-level resources. # This persona is useful for someone who needs access for auditing or even # support. These uses are also able to view project-specific resources where # applicable (e.g., listing all pools) SYSTEM_READER = 'role:reader and system_scope:all' # This check string is reserved for actions that require the highest level of # authorization on a project or resources within the project PROJECT_ADMIN = 'role:admin and project_id:%(project_id)s' # This check string is the primary use case for typical end-users, who are # working with resources that belong to a project (e.g., creating DNS zones) PROJECT_MEMBER = 'role:member and project_id:%(project_id)s' # This check string should only be used to protect read-only project-specific # resources. It should not be used to protect APIs that make writable changes. PROJECT_READER = 'role:reader and project_id:%(project_id)s' # The following are common composite check strings that are useful for # protecting APIs designed to operate with multiple scopes SYSTEM_ADMIN_OR_PROJECT_MEMBER = ( '(' + SYSTEM_ADMIN + ') or (' + PROJECT_MEMBER + ')' ) SYSTEM_OR_PROJECT_READER = ( '(' + SYSTEM_READER + ') or (' + PROJECT_READER + ')' )

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-13 23:15:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ecafccdba32c32351199218140ccfcdd9f81368a', 'message': 'Fix config option default value for sample config file

There are multiple places where nova set the new default
value for other (than nova) namespace config option for
example oslo lib config options. Examples:

- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20572809f2d8fefd72a7a059c4e82462a0d66262/nova/config.py#L62
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20572809f2d8fefd72a7a059c4e82462a0d66262/nova/policy.py#L48

and these defaults are reflected in code also which is working
as expected. But when config sample file is generated via

to add hook to reflect the new default in config generator
- https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.config/latest/cli/generator.html#modifying-defaults-from-other-namespaces

Fixing existing default value and if we find more or any future
change for default value, we need to add those config generator hook.

commit_message:
Fix config option default value for sample config file

There are multiple places where nova set the new default
value for other (than nova) namespace config option for
example oslo lib config options. Examples:

- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20572809f2d8fefd72a7a059c4e82462a0d66262/nova/config.py#L62
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20572809f2d8fefd72a7a059c4e82462a0d66262/nova/policy.py#L48

and these defaults are reflected in code also which is working
as expected. But when config sample file is generated via
oslo-config-generator tool (tox -egenconfig) then these defaults
which are set by Nova are not reflected as this tool take the
raw defaults. To solve this issue oslo config provide a option
to add hook to reflect the new default in config generator
- https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.config/latest/cli/generator.html#modifying-defaults-from-other-namespaces

We already doing it for middleware cors option
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20572809f2d8fefd72a7a059c4e82462a0d66262/setup.cfg#L41

Fixing existing default value and if we find more or any future

commit_message:
Move to quay.io with kuryr/demo docker image.

Change documentation and tests from 'demo/kuryr' which by default will
use docker registry to 'quay.io/demo/kuryr' which will hint about
quay.io registry.

commit_message:
doc: restrict supported Ceph versions

As discussed at the PTG [0] and subsequent Cinder meetings [1],
set a minimum supported version of Ceph.  Also specify that we
expect the Ceph client and server versions to be in alignment.

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CinderWallabyPTGSummary#Ceph:_Minimum_supported_version
[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/cinder/2020/cinder.2020-11-11-14.00.log.html#l-202

Change-Id: Ifd4cf76158350f60f84e3066ff41cc6ac5c2a3c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/92/762592/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: **Supported Ceph versions** The current `release cycle model for Ceph <https://docs.ceph.com/en/latest/releases/general/>`_ targets a new release yearly on 1 March, with there being at most two active stable releases at any time. For a given OpenStack release, *Cinder supports the current Ceph active stable releases plus the two prior releases.* For example, at the time of the OpenStack Wallaby release in April 2021, the Ceph active supported releases are Pacific and Octopus. The Cinder Wallaby release therefore supports Ceph Pacific, Octopus, Nautilus, and Mimic. Additionally, it is expected that the version of the Ceph client available to Cinder or any of its associated libraries (os-brick, cinderlib) is aligned with the Ceph server version. Mixing server and client versions is *unsupported* and may lead to anomalous behavior.

commit_message:
Do not install tempest plugin in train environments

Since train is a python2 env, expand the check in the
devstack plugin to not install the tempest plugin since
it is python3-only.

Change-Id: I67027090a8cc340b85fb1119f0e52bc1f2ffc66d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin refs/changes/28/763228/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # - the release is more recent than train (devstack in train would # try to install it in a python2 env, but octavia-tempest-plugin # is now a python3-only project) if [[ "$DEVSTACK_SERIES" != "stein" ]] || [[ "$DEVSTACK_SERIES" != "train" ]] || [[ "$(trueorfalse False INSTALL_TEMPEST)" == "True" ]]; then

release note we should follow up with a fixes release note now that
Ib9ed7069cef5b73033351f7a78a3fb566753970d has resolved this.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/71/758971/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: --- issues: - | `bug 1894804`_ documents a known device detachment issue with QEMU ``4.2.0`` as shipped by the Focal ``20.04`` Ubuntu release. This can lead to the failure to detach devices from the underlying libvirt domain of an instance as QEMU never emits the correct ``DEVICE_DELETED`` event to libvirt. This in turn leaves the device attached within libvirt and OpenStack Nova while it has been detached from the underlying QEMU process. Subsequent attempts to detach the device will also fail as it is no longer found within the QEMU process. There is no known workaround within OpenStack Nova to this issue. .. _bug 1894804: https://bugs.launchpad.net/qemu/+bug/1894804

commit_message:
Fix create/update_port with python3

unescape_port_kwargs() in api/neutron.py changes a key of dict
during the iteration and it is not allowed in python3.

Change-Id: Ifc1b9a0191aacd32e8c8ecc082b6313f04003f63
Closes-Bug: #1900851

added_lines: keys = list(kwargs) for key in keys:

commit_message:
Support for bulk port tagging extension

With the recent support added to Neutron to allow adding a tag to multiple
Ports at one call, this change stops Kuryr from performing two separate
requests to create the Ports and then Tagging them and just does it one
request.

Change-Id: I09496a9cd9cce4c3ae2c6a75c242aa46fa79a07d
Closes-Bug: #1899028

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I68d6faca20e5d8f1523dbd9f3e4f077a2680aa18
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/45/763945/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ensure egress NP works with Service without selectors

This commit ensures egress Network policy can also work with
services without selectors.

Change-Id: I26e1dce0b6e363f027ee6d4dfea99053ffe80bbe

commit_message:
Add intersphinx support for release notes

Adds the appropriate config and some documentation about how to
use intersphinx.  Also modifies the tox 'docs' and 'api-ref' envs
to copy the sphinx object inventory files generated during a build
over to the releasenotes directory and puts them under version
control so that they're available to the Zuul release notes jobs.

Change-Id: I5b47b41368c0dff5d96c96556f3ccbed1933539b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/20/762720/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os 'sphinx.ext.intersphinx',# for intersphinx # # Define the URL for external manuals. (What you want is the baseurl where # the 'objects.inv' can be found.) release_name = os.getenv('OS_RELEASE_NAME', 'latest').lower() docs_url = 'https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/%s/' % release_name api_ref_url = 'https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/' # # Specify a 'target-name': (url, local) mapping for each external manual. # (The 'local' is the location of an offline objects.inv to use.) intersphinx_mapping = { 'cinder-docs': (docs_url, None), 'cinder-api-ref': (api_ref_url, None), }

commit_message:
Add method to reserve the external subnet cidrs

Related-Bug: #1903433
Change-Id: Ic2333d1529d7749207bf81fc842963a5e5208306
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin refs/changes/26/763626/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cls.reserve_external_subnet_cidrs() @classmethod def reserve_external_subnet_cidrs(cls): client = cls.os_admin.network_client ext_nets = client.list_networks( **{"router:external": True})['networks'] for ext_net in ext_nets: ext_subnets = client.list_subnets( network_id=ext_net['id'])['subnets'] for ext_subnet in ext_subnets: cls.reserve_subnet_cidr(ext_subnet['cidr'])

commit_message:
[oslo] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I5cc6b3ff99d4d47549f85e425b04dcc765ff16a0

commit_message:
[Puppet OpenStack] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Icdd4a7b14f35ee51b614e530f05ace76dfad4665

commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: I4a3941c5a21560c6246d22e89d4566dcdc95bfd6
Closes-Bug: #1904962

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Id6ba4f68472205d9c8c0c43da7c1dc07042bc1c1
Sem-Ver: feature

subject: Enabling SG customization on loadbalancer listerners
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-14 08:01:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/25ad7cffa945edbad923b9dd7c2ab08f995a91fa', 'message': 'Enabling SG customization on loadbalancer listerners

By changing the SG ownership to belong to the tenant creating the
loadbalancer we allow the tenant to define more fine grain access
policies their loadbalancer, such as only enabling access to a given
port/protocol from a given remote id or subnet CIDR -- instead of
having to open that port/protocol from everywhere.

As this security group is only used for the amphora VM created for
the specific load balancer, and the user could already open access
to it through listeners on any port, protocol, giving full access to
modify the SG will not entitle any extra security concern.

Note this can be a temporal solution until Octavia enables this
flexibility through their own API

Change-Id: I2346c8a3f2fa4b4eb8a004b4aaab93986228c371
Story: 2003686

commit_message:
Enabling SG customization on loadbalancer listerners

By changing the SG ownership to belong to the tenant creating the
loadbalancer we allow the tenant to define more fine grain access
policies their loadbalancer, such as only enabling access to a given
port/protocol from a given remote id or subnet CIDR -- instead of
having to open that port/protocol from everywhere.

As this security group is only used for the amphora VM created for
the specific load balancer, and the user could already open access
to it through listeners on any port, protocol, giving full access to
modify the SG will not entitle any extra security concern.

Note this can be a temporal solution until Octavia enables this
flexibility through their own API

Change-Id: I2346c8a3f2fa4b4eb8a004b4aaab93986228c371
Story: 2003686

commit_message:
libvirt: Wire up a force disconnect_volume flag

I058ff0a0e5ad517507dc3cda39087c913558561d introduced a force flag for
disconnect_volume into the os-brick connector classes in 1.14.0.

This change simply wires up the same kwarg within the libvirt volume
classes for future use in scenarios where it is safe to force a
disconnect of a volume from a host, ignoring any failures to flush
caches etc.

Change-Id: Ia0666d5f53c4eb47ea865f9276bb8f457a95ac59

added_lines: def disconnect_volume(self, connection_info, instance, force=False): self.connector.disconnect_volume(connection_info['data'], None, force=force)

commit_message:
WIP nova-next: Deploy noVNC from source

This should help us identify issues such as bug #1822676 earlier before
the offending versions of noVNC are packaged.

This depends on I13c5638f320b18c4f6f945528352471d2bb31313 so that the
offending v1.1.0 version of noVNC is deployed by devstack when
NOVNC_FROM_PACKAGE=False.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669647/
Change-Id: I04b306e975430cfe1d3d758827b27f650bacbce3
Related-Bug: #1822676
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/90/671490/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Also starting in Train, the job now deploys noVNC from source in an effort to catch noVNC regressions earlier, such as bug #1822676.

commit_message:
Remove useless proto parameter from sample functions

Some functions in unit tests are creating namedtuples that represent
loadbalancers, these sample loadbalancer objects contain a 'protocol'
field that doesn't exist in real objects and isn't used.

Change-Id: I8f191a720a3d38a7f579ed5f587563bfd40cce15

commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: Ib8c2242c76106ecb41c267fe75f8f824e2934cc1
Closes-Bug: #1904962

commit_message:
Rewrite OpenStack on LXD page

This corrects inaccuracies, adds useful material,
and improves the organisation/writing. LXD
profiles in particular is better explained.

Page is more streamlined. Removed: creation of
multiple images and flavors; multiple deploy
commands; old networking configuration commands
that are not used in other documentation (even
though Mitaka is still supported). Python network
configuration scripts were replaced by native
openstack client commands.

Change-Id: Ib924acb52b9d90c945815087ee1227007ce8123e

commit_message:
Remove Images API v1 user guide

Version 1 of the Images API was removed in Rocky by Change
Ia086230cc8c92f7b7dfd5b001923110d5bc55d4d.  This patch removes
the version 1 "user guide" documentation.

Change-Id: Idc4986671df623f4e5a953c49918be66b973aada
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/29/762029/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: =========================== Adding a Member to an Image =========================== .. include:: deprecation-note.inc We want to authorize a tenant to access a private image. We issue a ``PUT`` request to ``http://glance.openstack.example.org/images/1/members/tenant1``. With no body, this will add the membership to the image, leaving existing memberships unmodified and defaulting new memberships to have \`can\_share\` set to \`false\`. We may also optionally attach a body of the following form: .. code:: {'member': {'can_share': true} } If such a body is provided, both existing and new memberships will have \`can\_share\` set to the provided value (either \`true\` or \`false\`). This query will return a 204 ("No Content") status code.

commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: Icd6698d7b15344b7ab1c14aad08ebc1cd61346f6
Closes-Bug: #1904962

subject: CI: add dummy1 port for seed upgrade and VM jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-24 10:45:49.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/kayobe-seed-vm-base/overrides.yml.j2', 'playbooks/kayobe-seed-upgrade-base/pre.yml', 'playbooks/kayobe-seed-upgrade-base/overrides.yml.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/0766df1673da0cc8c3a3d3d03e357ec5836e2d94', 'message': 'CI: add dummy1 port for seed upgrade and VM jobs

For some reason this configuration was omitted or incomplete in these
jobs. Without this configuration, Kayobe development configuration adds
eth1 to the breth1 bridge if it exists, or leaves the bridge without a
port otherwise. This can lead to network connectivity issues, if the IP
address of eth1 becomes inaccessible when it is added to breth1.

This change fixes the issue by ensuring that the dummy1 interface
exists, and configuring the aio network to add it to breth1 as a port,
instead of eth1.

Change-Id: I47115e5d8d1fb448cb9e46dc43b56c64987e428b
'}]
commit_message:
CI: add dummy1 port for seed upgrade and VM jobs

For some reason this configuration was omitted or incomplete in these
jobs. Without this configuration, Kayobe development configuration adds
eth1 to the breth1 bridge if it exists, or leaves the bridge without a
port otherwise. This can lead to network connectivity issues, if the IP
address of eth1 becomes inaccessible when it is added to breth1.

This change fixes the issue by ensuring that the dummy1 interface
exists, and configuring the aio network to add it to breth1 as a port,
instead of eth1.

Change-Id: I47115e5d8d1fb448cb9e46dc43b56c64987e428b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/59/763959/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: kolla_openstack_logging_debug: True # NOTE(mgoddard): CentOS 8 removes interfaces from their bridge during ifdown, # and removes the bridge if there are no interfaces left. When Kayobe bounces # veth links plugged into the bridge, it causes the bridge which has the IP we # are using for SSH to be removed. Use a dummy interface. aio_bridge_ports: - dummy1

commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: I814b6c6507116d91f4df6fa5911aab8a1b2f3911
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/76/761376/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow disabling automated_clean per node

This allows users to disable automated cleaning on
Node level.

Story: #2008113
Task: #40829

commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: I7437211ed249a552da7c9cbf1707ee929163c844
Closes-Bug: #1904962

commit_message:
Build containers for single consumer job

Make standalone job build containers when there is one single
consumer job in layout. Do not run content provider jobs in
this case.

Change-Id: I8f4bb37091fbe3b12ebc86758fd7584505270a7d
(cherry picked from commit efc95ebf4ae930663d7e49c57b8ee5b4fca994bf)

commit_message:
Remove count/flavor options from overcloud deploy

... because these options were supposed to be removed from the deploy
command during Ussuri release[1].

[1] 200d20a71c64b98afd87c1fb2e6babd25d18f442

Change-Id: I01cd598f090568283d1684e9f5a4d741d14ef4a0

subject: Make sure networks_skip_config defaults to []
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-19 02:36:49.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud.j2.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/c8c9855678540ffb77734d46d7dd76f2b58ebf94', 'message': "Make sure networks_skip_config defaults to []

The ansible network configs does a check if network
is in networks_skip_config. When networks_skip_config is
not defined in the role data it get's defined as 'null'
in the Ansible inventory.

Default it to an empty list when creating the GroupVars
so that it's always of type: List in the inventory.

Change-Id: I0c09118b947aeee9b011e7d0ec23ab99af3680af
Closes-Bug: #1904808
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure networks_skip_config defaults to []

The ansible network configs does a check if network
is in networks_skip_config. When networks_skip_config is
not defined in the role data it get's defined as 'null'
in the Ansible inventory.

Default it to an empty list when creating the GroupVars
so that it's always of type: List in the inventory.

Change-Id: I0c09118b947aeee9b011e7d0ec23ab99af3680af
Closes-Bug: #1904808
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/96/763296/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: networks_skip_config: {{ role.networks_skip_config|default([]) }}

commit_message:
[Container build] raise Exception post logging error

Currently it catches SystemError and log error message
but do not fail, raise SystemError so it fails too.

Closes-Bug: #1905348
Change-Id: I2e823c58779dba529a58aff5e0e1c0c880c267aa

commit_message:
Use _evacuate_server helper in func test

We have a nice helper for calling evacuate and waiting for the result so
let's replace the direct post api calls in func test with the helper.

Change-Id: I87a10e6ad65ae493cd34c6c0e62d60c5d6f9d1d8

Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: Ic3dee0bf0a73c57f24c446620e206c4f4a94c600
Closes-Bug: #1904962

commit_message:
Adopt grenade to multinode setting

* Change parent for grenade-heat-multinode job to grenade-multinode
* Use HOST_TOPOLOGY to specify multinode.
* Add irrelevant-files

Change-Id: I2abdf09bcd65441006f5315321e016e02704d6f1

commit_message:
Add support to Endpoints without targetRef

The targetRef field is optional for the Endpoints object,
and when service without selectors are created that field
is more likely to not be specified. This commit ensures
Kuryr properly wires Endpoints without targetRef.

Change-Id: Ib43e88aafd9e0907556a0e740990a6acbd173fb0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/92/761192/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def is_kubernetes_default_resource(name, namespace): return name == 'kubernetes' and namespace == 'default' def get_pod_by_ip(pod_ip): k8s = clients.get_kubernetes_client() pod = {} try: pods = k8s.get(f'{constants.K8S_API_BASE}/' f'pods?fieldSelector=status.podIP={pod_ip}') except exceptions.K8sClientException: LOG.exception('Error retrieving Pod with IP %s', pod_ip) raise if pods.get('items'): # Only one Pod should have the IP return pods['items'][0] return pod def get_current_endpoints_target(ep, port, spec_ports): target_ref = ep.get('targetRef', {}) if target_ref: return (ep['addresses'][0], target_ref.get('name', ''), p['port'], spec_ports.get(p.get('name'))) pod = get_pod_by_ip(ep['addresses'][0]) return (ep['addresses'][0], pod['metadata']['name'], p['port'], spec_ports.get(p.get('name')))

commit_message:
Reuse the docs deps to benefit from constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs,
which may not be supported by stable and lower branches,
so should be restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I1e134bb72b6fef3fba8f20d3b3d65520c66bbbf1

commit_message:
doc: Drop old Django information

The dropped information is about Ussuri release which dropped
Django 1.11 support. The information is no longer needed
as we are in Wallaby release.

Note that the referred bug is about a typo in the dropped note.
Closes-Bug: #1904855

Change-Id: Iee2b5a7f2c0d2a4e68db638d7f17e99884df42de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/78/763978/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: * Ussuri release uses Django 2.2 (the latest LTS) as the primary Django version. The prevouos LTS of Django 1.11 will be dropped during Ussuri cycle. Django 2.0 support will be dropped as well.

subject: [cinder] Transition Stein to EM
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-11 18:19:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/7bccbd303ada2ea84381a6c4ffc9e509cfd966e8', 'message': '[cinder] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

commit_message:
[cinder] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Icea2a40089bcd187fcc81ec6a470eae1bb981753

commit_message:
Import HTTPStatus instead of http_client

python introduced http.HTTPStatus since version 3.5,
and the OpenStack Victoria has targeted a minimum
version of python 3.6[1], cyborg also does that.

To keep update with the latest version we introduce HTTPStatus to replace http_client in cyborg code.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html

Change-Id: I4abecc96705573b27d651cab885d1416a39dabdb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/34/764134/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from http import HTTPStatus self.assertEqual(HTTPStatus.LOCKED, response.status_int) self.assertEqual(HTTPStatus.CREATED, response.status_int) self.assertEqual(HTTPStatus.NO_CONTENT, response.status_int) self.assertEqual(HTTPStatus.NO_CONTENT, response.status_int) self.assertEqual(HTTPStatus.NOT_ACCEPTABLE, response.status_code)
deleted_lines: from http import client as http_client self.assertEqual(http_client.LOCKED, response.status_int) self.assertEqual(http_client.CREATED, response.status_int) self.assertEqual(http_client.NO_CONTENT, response.status_int) self.assertEqual(http_client.NO_CONTENT, response.status_int) self.assertEqual(http_client.NOT_ACCEPTABLE, response.status_code)

commit_message:
CI: Fix ansible-lint failure

Currently ansible-lint is failing with:

    KeyError: 'hostvars'

This change fixes the issue by making the hostvars key optional. This
should not affect real usage, since an error is raised in this case.

Change-Id: I6dd482e95fa4f5508452d83bb64613d55eb1985f

subject: Always retry locking when performing task handoff
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-05 18:28:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/c20375c3d67d483b7d6d8a5e69366b95194f36e3', 'message': 'Always retry locking when performing task handoff

There are some Ironic execution workflows where there is not an easy way
to retry, such as when attempting to hand off the processing of an async
task to a conductor. Task handoff can require releasing a lock on the
node, so the next entity processing the task can acquire the lock
itself. However, this is vulnerable to race conditions, as there is no
uniform retry mechanism built in to such handoffs. Consider the
continue_node_deploy/clean logic, which does this:

  method = 'continue_node_%s' % operation
  # Need to release the lock to let the conductor take it
  task.release_resources()
  getattr(rpc, method)(task.context, uuid, topic=topic

If another process obtains a lock between the releasing of resources and
the acquiring of the lock during the continue_node_* operation, and
holds the lock longer than the max attempt * interval window (which
defaults to 3 seconds), then the handoff will never complete. Beyond
that, because there is no proper queue for processes waiting on the
lock, there is no fairness, so it's also possible that instead of one
long lock being held, the lock is obtained and held for a short window
several times by other competing processes.

This manifests as nodes occasionally getting stuck in the "DEPLOYING"
state during a deploy. For example, a user may attempt to open or access
the serial console before the deploy is complete--the serial console
process obtains a lock and starves the conductor of the lock, so the
conductor cannot finish the deploy. It's also possible a long heartbeat
or badly-timed sequence of heartbeats could do the same.

To fix this, this commit introduces the concept of a "patient" lock,
which will retry indefinitely until it doesn't encounter the NodeLocked
exception. This overrides any retry behavior.

  .. note::
     There may be other cases where such a lock is desired.

Story: #2008323
Change-Id: I9937fab18a50111ec56a3fd023cdb9d510a1e990

commit_message:
Always retry locking when performing task handoff

There are some Ironic execution workflows where there is not an easy way
to retry, such as when attempting to hand off the processing of an async
task to a conductor. Task handoff can require releasing a lock on the
node, so the next entity processing the task can acquire the lock
itself. However, this is vulnerable to race conditions, as there is no
uniform retry mechanism built in to such handoffs. Consider the
continue_node_deploy/clean logic, which does this:

  method = 'continue_node_%s' % operation
  # Need to release the lock to let the conductor take it
  task.release_resources()
  getattr(rpc, method)(task.context, uuid, topic=topic

If another process obtains a lock between the releasing of resources and
the acquiring of the lock during the continue_node_* operation, and
holds the lock longer than the max attempt * interval window (which
defaults to 3 seconds), then the handoff will never complete. Beyond
that, because there is no proper queue for processes waiting on the
lock, there is no fairness, so it's also possible that instead of one
long lock being held, the lock is obtained and held for a short window
several times by other competing processes.

This manifests as nodes occasionally getting stuck in the "DEPLOYING"
state during a deploy. For example, a user may attempt to open or access
the serial console before the deploy is complete--the serial console
process obtains a lock and starves the conductor of the lock, so the
conductor cannot finish the deploy. It's also possible a long heartbeat
or badly-timed sequence of heartbeats could do the same.

To fix this, this commit introduces the concept of a "patient" lock,
which will retry indefinitely until it doesn't encounter the NodeLocked
exception. This overrides any retry behavior.

  .. note::
     There may be other cases where such a lock is desired.

Story: #2008323
Change-Id: I9937fab18a50111ec56a3fd023cdb9d510a1e990

commit_message:
[kolla] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Ifbe2f7a4fac0d7c5b193737a19479a924166f9b3

subject: Use registry at quay.io instead of docker.io.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-11-18 13:02:14.000000000', 'files': ['test_container/Dockerfile.builder', 'test_container/mkrootfs.sh', 'test_container/rootfs.tar.xz', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'kuryr_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/base.py', 'test_container/README.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-tempest-plugin/commit/0746946003aa4223ffdf22c64bb9ec9d348adee7', 'message': "Use registry at quay.io instead of docker.io.

Lately, Docker.io started to limit their resources[1], so it started to

limits were hit. Let's move on to the quay.io.

commit_message:
Use registry at quay.io instead of docker.io.

Lately, Docker.io started to limit their resources[1], so it started to
be annoying in a cases of usual development, to typical test by CI
systems. Although our image is tiny, but still, we can observe that
limits were hit. Let's move on to the quay.io.

[1] https://www.docker.com/increase-rate-limit

Change-Id: I32af39344cb3e590a13bd07b64227d8acab6ccd0

commit_message:
Revert "Skip Trilio dirs when setting ownership in /var/lib/nova"

This reverts commit 63c522eb31d88933b8ccc6ccb08c4e7492e47ae9.

Reason for revert: Patch caused bug #1903033,also patches are currently
not being tested in CI in CentOS7 jobs thus breaking changes are being
merged, [1] should fix it. This can be re reverted or abandoned once fix for the issue is available.
Also testing if with [1] patches are also being included or not.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/763712

Change-Id: Ib8db275178b258140cc628aa0f940368982e86f1

commit_message:
Support volume safe delete

Change-Id: Ib8db275178b258140cc628aa0f940368982e86f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/75/758375/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================ Support erase disk data before delete volume ============================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/volume-safe-delete Problem description =================== Currently, the process of deleting volume is to directly call the interface of the driver layer to delete the volume, so as to quickly and directly delete the volume. This mode of volume deletion, in some backend storage systems, does not erase the data on disk completely, it simply deletes the data identity. This makes it possible to recover these data, causing certain unsafe factors to the sensitive data of users. This spec providing the ability to erase data on the cloud platform, regardless of the backend storage support data erasure, user can erase the data from the volume through the cloud platform, then call the driver to delete the volume. In order to protect the user sensitive data security. Use Cases ========= As an end user, I want to be able to completely erase volumes that contain sensitive data before removing them from backend storage, Thus eliminating the possibility of data being recovered. Proposed change =============== * Add a new quest parameter ``clear`` to the API of delete volume. It's value is a Boolean value, if omitted, this defaults to false. * The data is erased by writing zeros in the volume, to prevent the data on the disk from being recovered. * Bump an new microversion to keep forward compatibility. Vendor-specific changes ----------------------- None Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Delete volume API will accept a new quest parameter, which named ``clear``, and it's value is a Boolean value. This parameter is used by the user to safe delete the volume. This changes also need to bump the microversion of API to keep forward compatibility. * DELETE /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}?clear=True Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ If volume safe delete is enabled, the volume needs to be erased before the volume is deleted, the time taken will be greatly increased. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- haixin Work Items ---------- * Add ``clear`` as request parameter to the delete volume API * Make cinder client support volume safe delete * Add related test Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Add related unit tests * Add related tempest test Documentation Impact ==================== * The cinder API documentation will need to be updated to reflect the REST API changes. References ========== None

commit_message:
Skip test_create_object_with_transfer_encoding

test_create_object_with_transfer_encoding is failing
consistently since 20th Nov and blocking Cinder and
Swift gate.

- https://zuul.openstack.org/builds?job_name=tempest-integrated-storage

Let's skip this test until we find the fix.

Related-Bug: #1905432

Change-Id: I63c500920875c08ce7aba788742a04b9b3653daf

commit_message:
Bump minimum version of oslo.policy to 2.1.0

The changes following this one require `scope_types` which was added
in oslo.policy-1.32.0. Since version oslo.policy-1.30.0 was released
in late 2017 we should bump to at least oslo.policy-2.1.0 which was
released in late January 2019 bringing us a little closer to the
present time.

Change-Id: I02a2c42c0e1fceebbe6c81f8d674f62f90ee1670
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Remove adding allocation pool to existing allocation pool.

updating subnet info should take care of allocation pools too,
this will cause conflict exception and is against the descriptive
nature of ansible, thus there is no need toadding new pool to
the existing pool.

Task: 41307
Story: 2008384
Change-Id: I9983216e3b9abf69c8642ea4fc65c6d1e325fd13

commit_message:
[Ussuri Only] Ignore read-only "self" propery of images

This change makes sure that the "self" property is ignored when
managing glance images, because the propery is read-only and not
supposed to be updated.

This issue was introduced by the switch to openstacksdk which was done
in openstackclient during Ussuri cycle so this doesn't affect Train
and older releases. In addition uring the following patch was merged in
openstacksdk during Victoria cycle and "openstack image show" no longer
includes the self propery in image properties since Victoria. So this
change is submitted only for Ussuri.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/726626

Change-Id: Ie43ffe5075fac12be6dcae2771f9acde3cc16063
Closes-Bug: #1905404

subject: Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-09-30 03:05:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-vif/commit/fb7dc5eadab381c2e20624a164660749f10f647d', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I2155491aa65b11c36e0f2f7f0b53b405fb2b387a

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I2155491aa65b11c36e0f2f7f0b53b405fb2b387a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-vif refs/changes/68/755168/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: hacking>=3.0.1,<3.1.0 # Apache-2.0

commit_message:
Add missing dependencies about keystone_puppet_config

The keystone_puppet_config should be generated during configuration
phase, otherwise some resources which requires access to Keystone
api fails.

Change-Id: Iba6b8b16a2aa5e9a8ebbcc297f659767a5ce64af
(cherry picked from commit 92101bda25d4ff0c45e49209836acdac381e5945)
